references.paper_title: Combining human expertise with artificial intelligence: Experimental evidence from radiology
references.reason: This paper provides experimental evidence for human-AI collaboration in a high-stakes prediction task, directly supporting the paper's central argument.
This paper introduces a method for assessing whether human expertise adds value to algorithmic predictions, a key component of the proposed framework.

references.paper_title: Does the whole exceed its parts? The effect of AI explanations on complementary team performance
references.reason: This paper studies the benefits of AI collaboration in team settings, providing relevant context for the paper's focus on human-AI collaboration.
This paper introduces the theoretical concept of omnipredictors, which is used to define algorithmic indistinguishability, a key component of the framework.
This paper introduces the concept of multicalibration, a crucial tool for identifying algorithmically indistinguishable subsets of data where human expertise can improve predictions.
